England qualified on top of Group C and will face a third-place finisher in the last 16, with potential opponents including the Netherlands, Romania, Belgium, Slovakia, or Ukraine.
Slovenia celebrated their qualification to the last 16 in stark contrast to the disappointment of England's fans.
England are now on the opposite side of the draw to Germany, Spain, Portugal, and France, so cannot meet any of those sides until the final.
Slovenia's disciplined and diligent performance ensured their place in the knockout rounds.
England fans booed the team at halftime and again at the end of the match due to the lack of quality and penetration.
Gareth Southgate faced criticism from fans, with some calling for his resignation despite England topping Group C.
Gareth Southgate will be under more scrutiny as England scored just two goals in three group games.
England's last-16 opponents are yet to be confirmed, with the Netherlands a possibility.
Gallagher was removed at the break for Kobbie Mainoo, showing Southgate's displeasure at his latest midfield combination.
Palmer, like Mainoo, was bright off the bench and may now be in contention to start a knockout game on Sunday.
